20101206030504.000|20101206030506.000|CCO|DURING THE PANIC OF 2008, HE
20101206030506.000|20101206030508.000|CCO|COMMITTED TRILLIONS OF DOLLARS
20101206030508.000|20101206030510.000|CCO|TO RESCUE THE FINANCIAL SYSTEM,

20101206030515.333|20101206030517.000|CCO|CONTROVERSIAL, BERNANKE INTENDS

20101206030533.667|20101206030535.333|CCO|WE WANTED TO KNOW WHETHER WE'RE

20101206030543.667|20101206030545.333|CCO|BEEN AT 9.5% OR MORE FOR 16
20101206030545.333|20101206030547.000|CCO|MONTHS.

20101206030548.667|20101206030550.333|CCO|UNEMPLOYMENT RATE IS JUST NOT

20101206030554.000|20101206030556.000|CCO|SAME AS IT WAS IN MID-2009, WHEN

20101206030607.000|20101206030608.667|CCO|LEVELS.
20101206030608.667|20101206030610.333|CCO|>> Pelley: WE LOST ABOUT EIGHT

20101206030807.000|20101206030808.667|CCO|>> Bernanke: A LOT OF SMALL
20101206030808.667|20101206030810.333|CCO|BUSINESSES ARE NOT SEEKING

20101206030816.000|20101206030818.000|CCO|IS SLOW.
20101206030818.000|20101206030820.000|CCO|OTHERS ARE NOT QUALIFYING FOR
20101206030820.000|20101206030822.000|CCO|CREDIT, MAYBE BECAUSE THE VALUE
20101206030822.000|20101206030823.429|CCO|OF THEIR PROPERTY HAS GONE DOWN.

20101206030853.667|20101206030855.333|CCO|>> Pelley: BERNANKE'S FIRST

20101206030900.333|20101206030902.000|CCO|IT WAS THEN THAT HE GAVE US A

20101206030903.667|20101206030905.333|CCO|FEDERAL RESERVE HEADQUARTERS IN
20101206030905.333|20101206030907.000|CCO|WASHINGTON.
20101206030907.000|20101206030908.667|CCO|LAST MONTH, BERNANKE ANNOUNCED
20101206030908.667|20101206030910.333|CCO|THE FED'S INTENT TO BUY $600
20101206030910.333|20101206030912.000|CCO|BILLION IN U.S. TREASURY
20101206030912.000|20101206030913.667|CCO|SECURITIES, WHICH IS SUPPOSED TO
20101206030913.667|20101206030915.333|CCO|HAVE THE EFFECT OF LOWERING
20101206030915.333|20101206030917.000|CCO|RATES ON LONG-TERM LOANS FOR
20101206030917.000|20101206030918.667|CCO|THINGS LIKE CARS AND HOMES.
20101206030918.667|20101206030920.333|CCO|BERNANKE WANTED TO EMPHASIZE
20101206030920.333|20101206030922.000|CCO|THAT THESE ARE THE FED'S OWN
20101206030922.000|20101206030924.000|CCO|RESERVES.
20101206030924.000|20101206030926.000|CCO|IT'S NOT TAX MONEY; IT DOES NOT
20101206030926.000|20101206030928.000|CCO|ADD TO THE FEDERAL DEFICIT.
20101206030928.000|20101206030930.000|CCO|WHAT DID YOU SEE THAT CAUSED YOU
20101206030930.000|20101206030932.000|CCO|TO PULL THE TRIGGER ON THE $600
20101206030932.000|20101206030933.667|CCO|BILLION, AT THIS POINT?
20101206030933.667|20101206030935.333|CCO|>> Bernanke: IT HAS TO DO WITH
20101206030935.333|20101206030937.000|CCO|TWO ASPECTS.
20101206030937.000|20101206030938.667|CCO|THE FIRST IS UNEMPLOYMENT.
20101206030938.667|20101206030940.333|CCO|THE OTHER CONCERN I SHOULD
20101206030940.333|20101206030942.000|CCO|MENTION IS THAT INFLATION IS
20101206030942.000|20101206030943.250|CCO|VERY, VERY LOW, WHICH YOU THINK
20101206030943.250|20101206030944.500|CCO|IS A GOOD THING, AND NORMALLY IS
20101206030944.500|20101206030945.750|CCO|A GOOD THING.
20101206030945.750|20101206030947.000|CCO|BUT WE'RE GETTING AWFULLY CLOSE
20101206030947.000|20101206030948.250|CCO|TO THE RANGE WHERE PRICES WOULD
20101206030948.250|20101206030949.500|CCO|ACTUALLY START FALLING.
20101206030949.500|20101206030950.750|CCO|>> Pelley: FALLING PRICES LEAD
20101206030950.750|20101206030952.000|CCO|TO FALLING WAGES.
20101206030952.000|20101206030953.429|CCO|IT LETS THE STEAM OUT OF THE
20101206030953.429|20101206030954.857|CCO|ECONOMY, AND YOU START SPIRALING
20101206030954.857|20101206030956.286|CCO|DOWNWARD.
20101206030956.286|20101206030957.714|CCO|>> Bernanke: EXACTLY.
20101206030957.714|20101206030959.143|CCO|EXACTLY.
20101206030959.143|20101206031000.571|CCO|>> Pelley: THAT'S DEFLATION, AND
20101206031000.571|20101206031002.000|CCO|THAT'S WHAT HAPPENED IN THE
20101206031002.000|20101206031003.429|CCO|GREAT DEPRESSION.
20101206031003.429|20101206031004.857|CCO|HOW GREAT A DANGER IS THAT NOW?
20101206031004.857|20101206031006.286|CCO|>> Bernanke: I WOULD SAY, AT
20101206031006.286|20101206031007.714|CCO|THIS POINT, BECAUSE THE FED IS
20101206031007.714|20101206031009.143|CCO|ACTING, I WOULD SAY THE RISK IS
20101206031009.143|20101206031010.571|CCO|PRETTY LOW.
20101206031010.571|20101206031012.000|CCO|BUT IF THE FED DID NOT ACT,
20101206031012.000|20101206031013.429|CCO|THEN, GIVEN HOW MUCH INFLATION

20101206031054.500|20101206031055.750|CCO|INFLATION, I THINK, IS WAY

20101206031059.500|20101206031100.750|CCO|WE'VE ANALYZED IT EVERY WHICH
20101206031100.750|20101206031102.000|CCO|WAY.
20101206031102.000|20101206031103.429|CCO|ONE MYTH THAT'S OUT THERE IS
20101206031103.429|20101206031104.857|CCO|THAT WHAT WE'RE DOING IS
20101206031104.857|20101206031106.286|CCO|PRINTING MONEY.
20101206031106.286|20101206031107.714|CCO|WE'RE NOT PRINTING MONEY; THE
20101206031107.714|20101206031109.143|CCO|AMOUNT OF CURRENCY IN
20101206031109.143|20101206031110.571|CCO|CIRCULATION IS NOT CHANGING.

20101206031113.429|20101206031114.857|CCO|WHAT WE'RE DOING IS LOWERING

20101206031428.143|20101206031429.571|CCO|>> Bernanke: CLEANING UP THE TAX
20101206031429.571|20101206031431.000|CCO|CODE, FOR EXAMPLE.
20101206031431.000|20101206031432.250|CCO|THE TAX CODE IS VERY
20101206031432.250|20101206031433.500|CCO|INEFFICIENT, BOTH THE PERSONAL

20101206031436.000|20101206031437.250|CCO|BY CLOSING LOOPHOLES AND

20101206031456.000|20101206031457.667|CCO|HOW CONCERNED ARE YOU ABOUT THE

20101206031509.333|20101206031511.000|CCO|SHORT-TERM POLITICAL CONCERNS IN
20101206031511.000|20101206031512.667|CCO|ORDER TO DO WHAT'S BEST FOR THE
20101206031512.667|20101206031514.333|CCO|ECONOMY.
20101206031514.333|20101206031516.000|CCO|WE DO ALL OF OUR ANALYSIS, WE DO
20101206031516.000|20101206031517.667|CCO|ALL OF OUR POLICY DECISIONS

20101206031519.333|20101206031521.000|CCO|ECONOMY NEEDS, NOT BASED ON WHEN
20101206031521.000|20101206031523.000|CCO|THE ELECTION IS OR WHAT
20101206031523.000|20101206031525.000|CCO|POLITICAL CONDITIONS ARE.
20101206031525.000|20101206031527.000|CCO|>> Pelley: LIKE MANY ECONOMISTS,
20101206031527.000|20101206031529.000|CCO|BERNANKE BELIEVES IT WAS THE
20101206031529.000|20101206031531.000|CCO|FEDERAL RESERVE ITSELF THAT WAS
20101206031531.000|20101206031533.000|CCO|INSTRUMENTAL IN CAUSING THE
20101206031533.000|20101206031535.000|CCO|GREAT DEPRESSION WITH ITS TIGHT-
20101206031535.000|20101206031537.000|CCO|FISTED MONETARY POLICIES, SO HE
20101206031537.000|20101206031539.000|CCO|DID EXACTLY THE OPPOSITE.
20101206031539.000|20101206031541.000|CCO|IN THE PANIC OF '08, THE FED PUT
20101206031541.000|20101206031544.333|CCO|UP $3.3 TRILLION, AND JUST THIS
20101206031544.333|20101206031547.667|CCO|PAST WEEK, THE FED REVEALED WHO
20101206031547.667|20101206031551.000|CCO|GOT EMERGENCY HELP.
20101206031551.000|20101206031553.000|CCO|TURNS OUT, 21,000 TRANSACTIONS--
20101206031553.000|20101206031555.000|CCO|TO FINANCIAL FIRMS, INCLUDING
20101206031555.000|20101206031557.000|CCO|CITIGROUP, MORGAN STANLEY,
20101206031557.000|20101206031559.000|CCO|GOLDMAN SACHS; TO MAJOR
20101206031559.000|20101206031601.000|CCO|INDUSTRIALS COMPANIES, INCLUDING
20101206031601.000|20101206031603.000|CCO|G.E.; AND EVEN TO FOREIGN BANKS,
20101206031603.000|20101206031605.000|CCO|INCLUDING THE BANK OF ENGLAND.
20101206031605.000|20101206031607.000|CCO|MOST ALL OF THE LOANS HAVE BEEN
20101206031607.000|20101206031609.000|CCO|PAID BACK.
